item.title: China's robotaxi push sparks concerns about job security for drivers
item.description: China's yearslong effort to develop robotaxis is starting to gain traction with consumers — and rattling taxi drivers who are worried about losing their jobs

item.title: Shares of Stellar Blade maker Shift Up surge almost 50% on trading debut
item.description: The company sold 7.25 million shares in its IPO, raising 435 billion won or about $315.56 million.

item.title: E-scooter company to fit Melbourne fleet with AI cameras to stop riders using footpaths
item.description:
Neuron Mobility says technology is trained to recognise city’s roads and footpaths and will issue a warning in real time

  • Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates
  • Get our morning and afternoon news emails, free app or daily news podcast

Artificial intelligence-powered cameras will be installed across a major e-scooter rental company’s entire Melbourne fleet to stop riders travelling on footpaths.

Some Neuron Mobility e-scooters already have the front-facing cameras, but 1,250 more were set to carry the technology by the end of this year. It’s the first time an entire fleet would be decked out with the technology in a major city anywhere in the world, the company claimed.
